oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Minie ball from Battle of Sugar Creek.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Relic minie ball found at Sugar Creek in Lawrence County (Tenn." site of a skirmish during Gen. Hood's retreat from Middle Tennessee. The nose of the bullet shows evidence of having been "wormed" out of the musket. A small "worm" device, much like a cork screw, could be threaded onto the end of the musket ramrod. You then inserted the ramrod into the barrel and screwed the worm into the lead bullet and pulled it from the barrel. This was the only method to unload a muzzle loading weapon other than firing.
